To begin the school year in the safest way possible, we will NOT be hosting the annual Elementary Back to School Night, 7th/9th Grade Orientations or the Redhawk Recognition event. The information usually shared at these back-to-school events will be presented in an alternative format, either virtually or on the first day of school.

Redhawk athletic recognitions will be presented in an alternative format, with more information to come.

School will start as scheduled with the students assigned to our Red Team attending in-person on August 26th, and the students assigned to the White Team attending in-person on August 27th.

Preschool will begin on August 31st with the students assigned to the White Team attending in-person on that day. Students assigned to the Red Team will begin on September 1st. More specific information will be coming in an email from Mrs. Miller.

Students registered for the 100% Required Remote Learning option will receive an individual communication from their principal regarding the start of the school year.

From Mid-Iowa Community Action - MICA:

"Hardin, Marshall, Story, Poweshiek, and Tama counties have been declared by the governor as eligible for disaster assistance. Currently, many MICA offices are without power. We are working hard to equip disaster assistance teams to serve you as soon as we can. The latest updates and information will be available here on our Facebook and our website www.micaonline.org.
The Individual Iowa Disaster Assistance Program (IIDAP) offers grants to families whose household’s annual income is at 200% or less of the federal poverty level. Each qualifying household may receive up to $5,000.00 to help cover repairs, emergency food, temporary housing, or other losses. If you have access to the internet, you can get a start on your application at: https://dhs.iowa.gov/sites/default/files/470-4448%20Fillable.pdf?081220201652. We will let you know where to send your application and who to contact for assistance in each county as soon as possible."

Our grab and go lunch program wrapped up at the end of June and we wanted to update our community on the final totals.

Each student that picked up a bag on Thursdays received enough food for 5 breakfasts and 5 lunches. Over the course of the 11 weeks, our volunteers and lunch staff packed and served 34,120 meals.

These meals were paid for under a program through the USDA, which has different guidance than our normal school lunch program. We don't ordinarily qualify, but due to the extraordinary circumstances, the requirements were relaxed.

We are very grateful to all of the lunch staff and other school employees that made this program work each week. And we couldn't have done it without the volunteers that showed up each week to help pack and distribute meals. We're also thankful to the Salt Creek Wind Project for their generous contribution in support of the program.

The Traer Summer Sack Lunch program is now in operation to help fill the need in our community. Please visit the group page for more information: https://www.facebook.com/groups/467616230674394

Today’s senior in the spotlight is DaLynn Pokorny!

What is your favorite memory from your time at North Tama?
-My favorite memory from my time at North Tama is the band trip to New York City! It was the best trip that I’ve ever been on, and something I will surely never forget. I’m so thankful for the opportunities that North Tama, our teachers, and our community have provided for us!

What advice would you give to younger students?
-My advice to younger students is to get involved. Step out of your comfort zone, try new and interesting things, build relationships, and put yourself out there. You’ll be so thankful that you did when you look back and realize that the best memories were made while stepping out of your comfort zone! #ntproud #resilieNTredhawks
